title: Ticket #1126: Deploy TARGET scope correcting functions
description:
Now that we have functions to add TARGET scopes to expressions in the new ClassAd compatibility layer, we need to use them in the codebase. They need to be employed anywhere an expression is received from a user or a potentially old Condor process.

At some point in the future, many of these calls can be removed.

Locations for AddExplicitTargetRefs():

  • CondorQuery class [DONE]
  • Collector receiving a query ad [DONE]
  • Collector receiving an invalidation ad [DONE]
  • Startd receiving a query ad [DONE]

Locations for RemoveExplicitTargetRefs():

  • Schedd receiving constraints to identify jobs to act on [DONE]

Locations for AddTargetRefs():

  • Submit reading submit file [DONE]
  • Schedd receiving job attributes to set (submit and qedit) [DONE]
  • Schedd reading scheduler/local universe policy expressions from config file [DONE]
  • Schedd receiving machine ad from negotiator [DONE]
  • Schedd reading old ads from job queue log on startup [DONE]
  • Negotiator receiving job ad from schedd [DONE]
  • Negotiator reading matching policy expressions from config file [DONE]
  • Negotiator receiving machine ads from collector [DONE]
  • Startd receiving job ad for claim request [DONE]
  • Startd receiving job ad for claim activation [DONE]
  • Startd reading policy expressions from config file
  • Startd in a VM receiving ad of startd on physical machine [DONE]
  • Collector receiving machine ad [DONE]
  • Analyze receiving job ads [DONE]
  • Analyze receiving machine ads [DONE]
remarks:
2010-Jan-20 15:19:46 by jfrey:
Calls to these functions will have to be surrounded by a check for the macro WANT_OLD_CLASSADS. That is, only call the function if the macro isn't defined.

2010-Jan-21 17:03:06 by jfrey:
We should check if calls from soap clients to the collector and schedd follow separate codepaths that need separate checks.

2010-Jan-26 08:02:58 by jfrey:
Soap calls to the collector and schedd are covered.
